title.narrative: Humanitarian Assistance to Flood Affected people in Sri Lanka (HAFA)

description.narrative: • ADRA Sri Lanka is coordinating the procurement and distribution of: o back to school kits for 530 HHs. The kits provide basic school materials (backpack, exercise books, pencils, pens, eraser, lunch box, math set, ruler, water bottle, etc.) to allow children who lost all their belongings in the flood to return to school o kitchen kits for 530 HHs (Kettle, matches, plates, cups, spoons, knives, water jugs, cooking pots, utensils, and other supplies to allow families to cook again) o sanitation kits for 530 HHs (bed sheet, mosquito net, towel, bucket, laundry soap, washing soap, toothbrush and paste, sanitary pads, infant body lotion)

• The onset of the Southwest monsoon brought heavy rainfall to Sri Lanka since May 25, 2017, particularly the South, Southwestern, and Western regions. • As of 30 May (18:00, UTC+5:30), 604,700 people have been affected according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) in 15 districts across Sri Lanka. • Confirmed casualties have increased to 194 deaths, 99 people remain missing and 83,200 people are displaced in 376 safe locations. In Rathnapura District alone, 43,000 displaced people are in 181 locations. • About 1,400 houses have been destroyed and 7,070 houses partially damaged. Apart from the damage to the structure of houses, belongings are completely destroyed. Beds, mattresses, kitchen items are not usable. • Based on available information, at least 16 hospitals were evacuated fully or partially as facilities were directly affected by the floods or exposed to landslides
